intro: Lycurus setosus, commonly known as the hairy lycurus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Lycurus setosus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
